doc.previous: The volume of a sphere is the integral of an infinite number of infinitesimally small circular disks of thickness dx The calculation for the volume of a sphere with center 0 and radius r is as follows
doc.after: The radius of the circular disks defined such that the x axis cuts perpendicularly through them is
